unnormalised: The rupee is taking a beating, yaar! Forex markets are in a tizzy with the INR at ₹83.50 against the USD today, 16/10/2024. Experts are saying global uncertainties are to blame.
normalised: The rupee is taking a beating, yaar! Forex markets are in a tizzy with the I-N-R at rupee eighty three point five zero against the U-S-D today, sixteenth october two thousand and twenty four. Experts are saying global uncertainties are to blame.

unnormalised: Looks like travelling abroad is gonna get even more expensive. Planning that Europe trip? Budgeting in EUR might give you a mini heart attack. Euro is currently hovering around ₹90, up from ₹85 just a few months ago. Remember when $1 used to be like Rs. 60? Those were the days!
normalised: Looks like travelling abroad is gonna get even more expensive. Planning that Europe trip? Budgeting in E-U-R might give you a mini heart attack. Euro is currently hovering around rupee ninety, up from rupee eighty five just a few months ago. Remember when dollar one used to be like rupees sixty? Those were the days!

unnormalised: RBI is probably scratching their heads, trying to figure out how to stabilize things. Gold prices are also up, currently at ₹62,000 per 10 grams, adding to the inflationary pressures. The market seems volatile af.
normalised: R-B-I is probably scratching their heads, trying to figure out how to stabilize things. Gold prices are also up, currently at rupee sixty two thousand per ten grams, adding to the inflationary pressures. The market seems volatile as f.

unnormalised: Analysts suggest keeping a close eye on the GBP too; it's currently trading at ₹102. Time to dust off those piggy banks or maybe just prepone that Goa trip instead.
normalised: Analysts suggest keeping a close eye on the G-B-P too; it's currently trading at rupee one hundred and two. Time to dust off those piggy banks or maybe just prepone that Goa trip instead.
